sentences: Minnes kooli, võtsin kaasa oma taskulambi.
Talvel minnes voodermüüsse, tuli ette üllatuslikke leide.
Pärast tööd minnes koju, peatas ta poe juures.
context: 'Minnes' is the Estonian adessive case (elativ case) of the word 'minna', which means 'to go'. In this form, it functions as a temporal conjunction or participle meaning 'going', 'while going', or 'as one goes'. It's used to indicate simultaneous action - something that happens while someone is in the process of going somewhere. The adessive case here indicates the manner or time of an accompanying action.
